0 COMMENTS Supporters of the Workers' Party founder and Brazilian ex-president Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva take part in a May Day rally on Tuesday at Santos Andrade square in Curitiba, Brazil. Photo: Agence France-Presse/Getty Images
A daily roundup of corruption news from across the Web. We also provide a daily roundup of important risk & compliance stories vi a our daily newsletter, , which readers can sign up for here . Follow us on Twitter at @WSJRisk.
Bribery:
A Chinese energy company was identified in court documents in a bribery case of a former Hong Kong minister. The story didn’t contain a response. (SCMP)
The scale of bribery hasn’t changed since 2012 despite increased penalties. (Punch)
A French tycoon fighting allegations of bribery concerning his operations in Africa published an op-ed accusing authorities of racism. (Reuters, DT)
The retrial of a former New York State lawmaker has begun . He denies the allegations . (NYT, AP, NYP, AMNY, Reuters, CN, NYT, AP)
A Nigerian lawyer was sent to prison . (Pulse)
A Long Island corruption trial continues . (Newsday)
A former Brazilian soccer chief is appealing his ban from the sport. (IWF)
Cybercrime:
Mexico’s monetary authority told banks to take steps against a suspected cyberattack . (Bloomberg, Bloomberg)
Fraud:
U.K. authorities launched a new probe into banking fraud at HBOS. Its owner, Lloyds Bank, said it welcomed the investigation. (Guardian, Reuters)
Polish businessmen were charged with tax fraud. The story didn’t contain a response. (RP)
Money Laundering:
Art dealers are pushing back against new European anti-money laundering requirements. (ArtNet, TAN)
Have the U.K. hired enough staff to embark on its anti-money laundering crackdown ? Thousands of firms face a shutdown . (BB, HS, National, HS)
The head of the U.K.’s tax authority defended its refusal to raid a suspected money launderer but admitted it shouldn’t have mentioned the company’s political donations when doing so. (BuzzFeed)
Anonymous owners of real estate have dramatically increased. (NYT)
The co-founder of Backpage.com said his money laundering trial, scheduled to begin in 2020, is “ nonsense .” (AP)
The number of suspicious activity reports filed in Hong Kong has quadrupled over the past six years. (SCMP)
Libya will receive U.K. help with pursuing money-laundering cases. (Xinhua)
Anti-money laundering enforcement in Malta needs to be more agile and efficient, the new watchdog said. Protesters held a demonstration. (ToM, MI)
The absence of a judge delayed a money-laundering trial. (Nation)
Costa Rica fined a bank for money-laundering failures. (CRT)
Pakistani investigators will go to the U.K. to collect evidence in a money-laundering case. (DT)
An Indian tycoon was in a U.K. court for his extradition hearing in a money-laundering case; he denies the allegations. Authorities continue to work on money-laundering cases. (DB, ET, ToI)
Sanctions:
Israel’s claims that Iran lied about its nuclear ambitions led to renewed threats to the nuclear deal . Tehran said the claims were a childish show . European nations stressed the need for the deal to remain . Atomic watchdogs didn’t respond to Israeli claims. (Reuters, Haaretz, Haaretz, CNBC, Guardian, Reuters, NYT, Guardian, Yahoo, Reuters, Haaretz, Haaretz, Reuters, Reuters, Reuters, AFP, Reuters)
The Russian premier backs a proposal to criminalize compliance with U.S. sanctions. Moscow also banned Lithuanian politicians in Russia in response to Vilnius imposing sanctions. (Reuters, Reuters)
U.S. prosecutors charged three businessmen with violating export controls on Iran. The story didn’t contain responses. (MN)
The U.S. isn’t trying to put Rusal out of business with sanctions, according to the Treasury Secretary. (Bloomberg)
Whistleblowers:
A Russian doping whistleblower filed a countersuit against Russian Olympic athletes and their backer, an oligarch who owns the Brooklyn Nets. The oligarch denies the allegations (NYT, AP, NYLJ)
General Anti-Corruption:
Brazilian prosecutors filed new corruption charges against jailed former president Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva and his former party chief. Neither could be immediately reached. Meanwhile, the country’s current president is at a standstill and canceled a trip to Asia to fight his own corruption allegations. (AFP, Reuters, Bloomberg, Bloomberg)
Nigerian nonprofits sent a letter to U.S. President Donald Trump asking him to demand a list of corrupt officials from their president during a White House visit. (PM, Pulse, ChannelsTV)
Malaysians created a board game to mock the 1MDB case. (AFP)
Leaked documents show U.K. police corruption. (BBC)
The U.S. special counsel’s probe continues , as reports surfaced of questions posed directly to the president. The president lashed out in response . (CNN, AP, NYT, NBC, Politico, NYT, Yahoo)
